distorOrdPrc.ordInstr: Call (202-366-DATA), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2014 DVD. This and other BTS products may be ordered from the BTS Internet site (<http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/>).

distorFormat.fileDecmTech: No compression applied. However, if using digital transfer online option, note access instructions.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The National Highway Planning Network is a comprehensive network database of the nation's major highway system. It consists of the nation's highways comprised of Rural Arterials, Urban Principal Arterials and all National Highway System routes. The data set covers the 48 contiguous States plus the District of Columbia, Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico. The nominal scale of the data set is 1:100,000 with a maximal positional error of ±80 meters.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The primary purpose of this geospatial data set is to serve the FHWA needs in highway planning, policy analysis, visualization of the Highway Performance Monitoring System (HPMS) database and network modeling. The NHPN is the digital source used for coding and publishing the FHWA approved National Highway System maps.

Consts.useLimit: The NHPN Version 11.09 database, or any portion thereof, can be freely distributed as long as this metadata entry is included with each distribution. The original metadata entry cannot be modified or deleted from any data transfer.

report.measDesc: Topological relationships of node and link and uniqueness of entity IDs are verified by the computer algorithm developed under ArcGIS 9.1 environment.

The complete urban principal arterial system and arterials in rural areas as reported to FHWA by December 1992 are inventoried in the database. Functional classification as reported in HPMS 2007, NHS system and intermodal connectors are reported to the FHWA by 2003. SIGN1, LNAME, route designation, route direction and route milepost as reported in HPMS 2002 are updated. Functional classes below arterial vary on a state-by-state basis. Any addition and modification to the National Highway System as reported to the FHWA by February 2010 is also included.

OST-R/BTS quality checks were for cross referencing purposes . The dataset was cross-referenced with the state dataset to determine if the spatial data and attribute data were accurate within each state.

The original elements of the NHPN have been conflated to the 1:100,000 DLG-3 data set, which maintains a nominal accuracy of at least ±80 meters. Where new roads have been added which are not in the DLG-3 database, link alignments have been digitized or converted from digital sources acquired from state DOTs with a map scale of at least 1:100,000. Where State data source was not available, CENSUS TIGER/Line 2000 was used.

prcStep.stepDesc: Update and rebuild Linear Referencing System to the NHPN V 2002.10. State data used for LRS attribute information.
Conversion of Spatial co-ordinate system from NAD 27 to NAD 83.
Updated CENSUS small urban area code and HPMS urbanized area code to the arc and node features.
Created new NHPN route system from the NHPN arc's embedded route information with the aid of computer algorithm developed under ArcGIS environment.
Coverage to geodatabase conversion.

NHPN V.4 Route System's directionality, Route Attribute Table and milepost anchor values verified with state-submitted HPMS data elements. Anomalies are corrected or modified onto the NHPN V 2002.10 route system.
Further integration of Ramp Group Cordon Boundary nodes into the NHPN for future addition of ramp group features. States edge matched, NHS attributes verified.

Integration of Ramp Group Cordon Boundary nodes into the NHPN for future addition of ramp group features. States edge matched, NHS attributes verified, and national LRSKEY added to facilitate a national route system.
Verified Intermodal terminals.

Changed STRAHNET codes 1, 2, and 3 to 6, 1 and 2 respectively. Replaced definition of codes 3, 4 and 5 as Rural Non-Designated Interstate, Urban Designated Interstate and Urban Non-Designated Interstate respectively.
Added STRAHNET connectors and corresponding to FAC_ID and CONN_DES.
Identified and assigned status code 2 to the ferry routes.
Corrected topological errors using ArcGIS 8.3 geodatabase topology rules.
Conflation of NHPN V1 to DLG-3 road alignments using R-MATCH software developed by the Geographic Information Systems Group, University of Tennessee.
Attachment of a Linear Referencing System to the NHPN V2. State Data used for LRS attribute information.
Integration of intermodal connector links into the NHPN V2. States edge matched and NHS attributes verified.
Modified NHS codes as per direction of the FHWA. NHS codes 2,5, and 6 as reported in the previous versions of NHPN were changed to 7,3, and 4 respectively.
Verified arcs direction with state submitted GIS data and HPMS.
Update and integrate intermodal terminals. States geo-location matched and attributes verified.
Update of Linear Referencing System to the NHPN V4.0. State data used for LRS attribute information.
Modified NHS based on ammendments
Transferred route information from the NHPN route to the NHPN arc features
Digitizing and converting of state-supplied digital and map data. Line work geodetically controlled to match DLG-3 line work.
Integration of conflated version of NHPN V1 and assimilated state data into a comprehensive topologically integrated network database. States edge matched and NHS attributes verified.
Integration of supplemental state data into the NHPN V2. NHS attributes verified.
Update NHS and intermodal connector links. States edge matched and NHS attributes verified.

Conflation of NHPN V.4 RAT data to NHPN V 2002.10 arc and calibrate arc milepost LRS anchor information using R-TAG Interface developed by the Transport Modeling and GIS-T Applications Group, Transportation & Space division, Battelle, Columbus, Ohio.
Added status code as per direction of the FHWA. Status code 2 was added to identify ferry routes.
Assigned road name attributes for arcs where SIGN values are not available.
Update LRS directionality and calibrate LRS milepost attribute value to match state supplied HPMS to the NHPN V 2002.10 route system. State and FHWA HPMS-2001 data used for LRS attribute information.
Revised and modified arc feature's topology direction with state submitted route feature and/or HPMS route direction.

dataSource.srcDesc: Alignment, shape and location of intermodal connectors and terminals
Provided a platform for topological Q/C analysis.

dataSource.srcDesc: Road alignments for rural and urban highways.

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Bruce Peterson, Oak Ridge National Laboratory

dataSource.srcDesc: Alignments and attributes for urban highways. Sign route and function class attributes for principal arterial system.
Updated FAC_ID, CONN_ID, CONN_DES and CONN_MILES. All the updates were made on this version of the NHPN

Fixed LRS route direction to match HPMS mileage direction. Calibrate LRS milepost attribute value to match state supplied HPMS. Create/modify of new LRS Routes to match state supplied HPMS. Assign a road name attribute for arcs where SIGN values are not available.

srcCitatn.resTitle: Geographic Information System (GIS) Data and paper maps

dataSource.srcDesc: Alignment, shape and location of ramp features
Delineated STRAHNET Priority 1 and Priority 2 connectors.
Assign CENSUS Small Urban Area code. Assign HPMS Urbanized Area code. Assign Rural/Urban Code.

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Transport Modeling and GIS-T Application Group, Transportation & Space division, Battelle

dataSource.srcDesc: Calibration of LRS milepost attribute value. Creation of new LRS Routes.
Alignments, sign route NHS classification for National Highway System.
Alignment, shape and location of intermodal connectors and terminals

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Identifies arc file records.

Used for maintaining consistency across data files containing alternate releases of the NHPN. The Version Code consists of a leading Version Number (the year of release) and a trailing number (the month of release), thus, 2004.06 describes Major Release for the year 2004 and month 06.
A unique numeric ID associated with each arc of NHPN version 2004.06.
A unique numeric ID associated with each arc of previous versions of NHPN as appropriate.
3 digit FIPS code for the county the arc resides.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute for Standards and Technology (NIST)

attr.attrdef: Source of arc
3 digit HPMS Urbanized Area code for the Urbanized Area in which the arc lies. A value of 0 indicates the arc is outside any HPMS Urbanized Areas.
5 digit CENSUS Small Urban Area code for cities under 50,000 population in 2010. A value of 0 indicates the arc is outside any Small Urban Area.
Contains the designated primary Sign Route for the arc.

attrdomv.udom: The character string is composed of three sub fields SIGNT1, SIGNN1, and SIGNQ1.

attr.attrdef: Describes the type of the sign route.
Contains the actual sign route numbers . Using HPMS standards, an optional directional indicator (N, S, E, W) can also be used as part of this field.
Sign Route Qualifier Record which is used to qualify the sign route description follows the Sign Route Number.

edom.edomvd: No Qualifier, not signed, or not applicable.

attr.attrdef: Contains the designated secondary Sign Route for the arc.

attrdomv.udom: The character string is composed of three sub fields SIGNT2, SIGNN2, and SIGNQ2.

attr.attrdef: Describes the type of the sign route.
Contains the actual sign route numbers . Using HPMS standards, an optional directional indicator (N, S, E, W) can also be used as part of this field.
Sign Route Qualifier Record which is used to qualify the sign route description follows the Sign Route Number.

edom.edomvd: No Qualifier, not signed, or not applicable.

attr.attrdef: Contains the designated additional secondary Sign Route for the arc.

attrdomv.udom: The character string is composed of three sub fields SIGNT3, SIGNN3, and SIGNQ3.

attr.attrdef: Describes the type of the sign route.
Contains the actual sign route numbers . Using HPMS standards, an optional directional indicator (N, S, E, W) can also be used as part of this field.
Sign Route Qualifier Record which is used to qualify the sign route description follows the Sign Route Number.

edom.edomvd: No Qualifier, not signed, or not applicable.

attr.attrdef: Contains the local street name for the arc.

attrdomv.udom: Should not contain any punctuation characters other than blank, and hyphen. Wherever possible CENSUS Feature Type abbreviations should be used to shorten the local name.

attr.attrdef: Contains measurement in miles for the arc chain.
Contains measurement in kilometers for the arc chain.
Identifies the assigned functional class of each arc.
attr.attrdefs: Original functional classification codes came from data sources submitted as part of 1992 Functional Reclassification by State agencies. For segments on the National Highway System this attribute has been quality controlled against the 2002 HPMS.

attr.attrdef: Describes the Rural/Urban classification of the arc.
Describes availability of the arc to through traffic.

Special subnetwork for the National Highway System. The following values were converted per direction from the FHWA: 2 (ISTEA High Priority Corridor) was converted to 7 (Other NHS) , 5 (ISTEA High Priority Corridor/ Non-Interstate STRAHNET) was converted to 3 (Non-Interstate STRAHNET), 6 (ISTEA High Priority Corridor/STRAHNET Connector) was converted to 4 (STRAHNET Connector).
Special subnetwork for the Strategic Highway Corridor Network.
FHWA designated Intermodal Facility unique ID.
FHWA designated Intermodal Facility Connector unique ID
Description of Intermodal Facility Connectors
Total Mileage of the designated Connector.
Uniquely identifies a route within a state.

attrdomv.udom: Created by combining 2 data items from the HPMS: the 12 character LRS Identification field (HPMS Data Item 10) plus the 3 character County FIPS Code (HPMS Data Item 4).

attr.attrdef: NHPN arc mile point sequence number.
Beginning mile point for the NHPN arc segment.
Ending mile point of the NHPN arc segment.
The Annual Average Daily Traffic field comes from the 2002 Highway Performance Monitoring System.

The Number of through lanes field indicates the number of striped lanes in both directions. This field does not include auxiliary lanes, such as collector-distributor lanes, weaving lanes, frontage road lanes, parking and turning lanes, acceleration/deceleration lanes, toll collection lanes and truck climbing lanes.
Identifies the road owner
State FIPS Code
